content.description:
The Overview Effect climbs a beautiful vertical wall through a series of edges over a great landing.

Sit start with hands matched on an edge. From there, make a big move to a horizontal edge, match on it, then work up the remainder using good edges to reach an easy mantle.
content.protection: A pair of pads, the landing is great though.
content.location: This is on the East face of People's Boulder.

content.description:
Disconnected is my favorite problem in Unaweep. It is a beautiful line, has quality golden sandstone and cool features, and has an obvious start & finish. Go see for yourself. Start sitting with the obvious jug rail just left of

My Fleshy Oslo

.
content.location:
It is left of

My Fleshy Oslo

.

content.description:
My Fleshy Oslo climbs a slightly overhung arete on one of the coolest pinch moves in the canyon.

Stand start with a left hand on the arete and a right hand edge. From there, gain the high feet, bump the left hand further up the arete, adjust the feet, stand up tall to an incredible left hand pinch, find a right foot edge next to the right hand, pull through the thin right hand edges, reach the lip, match, and mantle on top the boulder.

A sit can be done to add some moves as well.
content.protection: At least a pair of pads. The landing starts out well, but the second half of the problem climbs over a few rocks that may be an issue.
content.location: It climbs the south facing arete/face of People's.
